reviews.review: Хорошая игра, интересный сюжет.

I was recommended to check this game out by a few people and as a person who usually sucks at puzzle games, I didn't think I'd like it. Turns out I was wrong. I picked this game up as a combo sale with it's sequel and I am truly glad I did. The graphics, puzzles, and design are great but it's the humor that knocks it out of the park for me. If you like puzzles and a good laugh, don't hesitate to check this one out!

Eu achei que esse jogo fosse ruim, Eu admito, até mês passado eu só gostava do Portal 2, mas o Portal 1 também é AWESOME! O jogo rodou perfeitamente no meu PC (da Xuxa) e a luta final me deixou com o coração na mão..... Não é a toa que Portal é uma das minhas seriés de jogos favoritas :D
Why are you reading this review? Do you not own Portal yet? GET TO IT

Portal is one of the best games ever made.

It really makes you use your brain and i like how straightforward the gameplay is, but i am still mad about the cake

Portal is a first person puzzle oriented game developed by Valve Corporation. The game version which is available in Steam was release on 10th October 2007 as a content of Orange Box. There are many other versions of this game. This game concept came from the game "Narbacular Drop". When valve designed the game there are many developer from Narbacular Drop developer team. The latest release of this game was an Android port for the NVidia Shield which was released on 12th May 2014. A sequel, Portal 2, was released in 2011.

         This game is designed with several sets of puzzles which are distributed into 19 Test Chambers. The player character Chell have to solve the puzzles using teleporting. At the starting point of every test chamber there is a projector for briefing. Chell have to grab “the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device” also known as portal gun. By using that gun Chell can make two kinds of portals one is blue portal other is orange portal. From game play we come to know that Chell is solving these puzzles as the Aperture Science Enrichment Center promised to give her a cake at the end of all 19 tests. Throughout the game the artificial intelligence GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System) will monitor Chell. At the end of last test chamber we come to know that the promise of cake is fake. The main objective of the game is to solve 19 puzzles & rescue herself form that fake promise. At the end of the game if you can destroy GLaDOS you can get that promised cake. Though from the game play we came to know "The cake is lie". But as per my point of view it's not a lie. 
         This science fiction game is not as long as valve’s other games, it takes hardly 2-3 hours to complete the 19 puzzles, though till date over four million copies of the game have been sold. The player character Chell is portrayed by Alésia Glidewell & voiced by Mary Kae Lrvin. GLaDOS is voiced by Ellen McLain in English-language version and finally the end credits song “Still Alive” written by Jonathan Coulton also sang by Ellen McLain.
        Though it’s a short game but still I’ll recommend to purchase & play. I’m sure after playing you will realize why this game is so popular till date. Now I'm waiting for Portal 2

SPOILER ALERT!!!
This is a game about a homicidal robot, that at the end of the game, is supposedly murdered by a young woman with a gun that's actually a teleportation device. You play the woman and you must survive the experiments thrown on you. If this sounds fun, buy it. If it doesn't, buy it. There's no need for a demo. JUST BUY IT!

This game is hands down one of my favorites, if not my favorite overall . 
It's engaging and sometimes stops and makes you think, which I find fun because who doesn't enjoy a challenge? Some of the test chambers do have challenging elements where you have to stop and actually plan your portal placement and the quick moves you need to make to execute the level. I love that even after playing the game before, I still sometimes need to stop and think about the challenge ahead.
 I find it to be really unique as well, and although I've played this game multiple times, I never get tired of it. I own it for both console and PC and really - it's just become a staple in my household and a classic that I enjoy sharing with others.
I highly recommend it for anyone who hasn't taken the Portal plunge yet. DO IT!

Это очень классная, красивая, проработанная игра, но короткая. Некоторые уровни могут оказатся очень сложными и могут заставить напрячь ваш мозг.

Oh, how I ADORE the Portal franchise. My first foray into Portal was when I picked up Portal 2 on PS3. I had never even heard of it before, but it looked intruiging. Oh boy, how I was right. I loved Portal 2, and was disappointed to find out I couldn't play Portal 1 on PS3 unless I bought the Orange Box, which I could not do because I was not 17 at the time. Fast forward to Christmas 2014 and I recieved a laptop that I could do some gaming on, which is when I got Steam. Portal was immediately one of the first games I bought for it. Let me tell you, I absolutely loved it. While it's not nearly as meaty/large as it's sequel, Portal is still a tight and enjoyable experience. While my first playthrough (I intend on replaying sometime soon with developer commentary!) was only 2.5 hours, it was a fun and actually unique experience in comparison with Portal 2. The puzzles were different and I still felt like I had to rack my brain a bit to solve them. Overall, I highly recommend this game, 9/10

Portal, eines der besten Spiele aller Zeiten, da es als Schooter mit einer Waffe dass hinkriegt, was sehr viele andere mit 2 Dutzend Waffen nicht hinbekommen und zwar Spieltiefe.

Die Spielzeit ist mit etwa 2-3 Stunden recht kurz, aber für denn Preis und denn Spaß denn man auch beim häufigeren Durchspielen hat, defenetiv ein "must play".

Die Kombination aus Rätseln, Springen, Experementieren und dem Humor macht das Spiel zu einem Spiel für alle, auch für Die die, die eher wenig mit Schootern anfangen können.

Dann ist dieses Spiel genau richtig für euch.

[h1]Innovativer Spielspaß[/h1]
Dieses Spiel bietet ein innovatives Spielerlebnis. Man versucht durch immer komplexer werdende Level durchzukommen. Dabei muss man verschiedene Hindernisse überwinden und mit verschiedenen Objekten aus der Umgebung interagieren. Dabei bietet das Spiel auch eine Story, die einen meiner Meinung nach ganz besonderen Charme hat. Seien es Sprüche von GLaDos oder besondere Objekte. 
Eine weitere Besonderheit, die den Wiederspielwert steigert: Die Entwickler haben eine Version mit Entwicklerkommentaren erstellt. Dabei findet man an verschiedenen, sichtbaren Stellen Sprechblasen, mit denen man interagieren kann. Die Entwickler erzählen in englisch, was sie sich bei der Raumkonstellation gedacht haben. Das ist schön zu hören, zumal man mitbekommt, dass sich manche Räume doch ein wenig verändert haben in der Testphase. Auch die Synchronsprecherin für GLaDos berichtet über ihre Eindrücke und Erlebnisse während der Spieleentwicklung. Die Kombination "Spiele das Spiel und höre, was die Entwickler sich in diesem und diesem Raum gedacht haben" gibt dem ganzen einen besonderen Flair. 

Fazit: Jeder, der mal ein neues, innovatives Spiel spielen möchte, sollte sich diesen Titel holen. Meiner Meinung nach haben die Entwickler alles richtig gemacht. Die technische Umsetzung ist meines Erachtens ebenfalls gut gelungen und die Grafik sehr ansehnlich und passend zum Spiel, schlicht gehalten.

Ja sehr! Ich habe es zwar in 3 Stunden durch gehabt, war jedoch schon geeicht, weil ich den 2ten Teil vorweggespielt habe! Die Story ist tiefsinniger als man denkt, bisweilen auch gesellschaftskritisch und das Gameplay einfach nur revolutionär! Für Neulinge 5 Stunden Brainfakks und Emotionschaos!

おおざっぱにいうと面クリ型のパズルゲーム。進むに従っていろんなトラップやアイテムも登場しますがゲーム内でちゃんと説明してくれます。
中にはどうすんのこれ？というパターンもありますがじっくり考えれば必ず解決法はあります。
画面構成とかはとてもシンプルだけど安っぽさは全然感じないグラフィックだと思います。
ちょっとだけ残念な点は、タイミングが要求されるアクションを要求する面があるということ。ちょっと操作性がよくないのでちょっとしたタイミングでつまづいちゃったりします。できればじっくり頭だけ使いたかったんですけどね。
総合的にはパズル系が好きな方ならおすすめです。ただクリアしていくだけじゃなくいちおうストーリーもありますのでそちらもお楽しみください。
je recommande ce jeu à tout ceux qui cherche un jeu de reflexion, certaine enigmes sont plutôt complexe mais c'est vrai que ça durée de vie est plutôt courte (3/4 heures environ).

Portal is like not other puzzel game I've ever played. 

It has a deep story line with lots of easter eggs hidden in the levels. 

Once you've played this game for a few levels you're hooked and will never be able to get the epic one liners out of your daily conversation.  A must play for everyone!
nice game, good.

Recuerdo vagamente haber jugado los primeros momentos de este juego hace mucho en un cyber. Como era un tiempo limitado, no pude ver completamente lo que ofrecia el juego y, por ende, borre aquellas secuencias de mi memoria. Teniendo ese recuerdo en mente, compre este titulo. Disfrutarlo completo fue una muy buena experiencia; Sentia un latente temor de que fuera demasiado complicado y terminara desistiendo, pero no fue asi, ya que los unicos sectores que me parecieron un reto fueron los ultimos dos y, a pesar de las reiteradas derrotas, logre salir victorioso. Cuando mi tarjeta tenga un tantito mas, me compro la secuela sin dudarlo. Absolutamente todo es perfecto.
Larga vida a Valve.
great game!
